description: Numbers n such that sum of proper divisors s(n) is a triangular number T(k).
example: s(14)=1+2+7=10 is a triangular number. In fact T(4)=10.
mathematica: tri[ n_ ] := Module[ {}, a=Floor[ N[ Sqrt[ 2n ] ] ]; a(a+1)/2==n ]; Select[ Range[ 300 ], tri[ Apply[ Plus, Divisors[ # ] ]-# ]& ]
author: _Felice Russo_
